Text: : Luol Deng and Carlos Boozer each scored 21 points, and Joakim Noah had his second career triple-double with 11 points, 13 rebounds and 10 assists as the Bulls dominated the visiting Boston Celtics 100-89 on Tuesday. The Bulls maintained the lead that came from a very well played first half, and never trailed in the second half. Rajon Rondo had 26 points for the Celtics, who have lost three games in a row
